intro: Silene urodonta, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and meadows. Silene urodonta has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
